intro: Lithophragma nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem lithophragma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features hairy stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Lithophragma nudicaulis is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
